metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1640 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
axiom-test.sh in axiom 20100701-1.1 uses tempfile to create a safe temporary file but appends a suffix to the original filename and writes to this new filename, which allows local users to overwrite arbitrary files via a symlink attack on the new filename.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1640` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

axiom - 20120501-17
axiom-databases - 20120501-17
axiom-graphics - 20120501-17
axiom-graphics-data - 20120501-17
axiom-hypertex - 20120501-17
axiom-hypertex-data - 20120501-17
axiom-source - 20120501-17
axiom-test - 20120501-17
axiom-tex - 20120501-17
No subscription required

criterions.comment: axiom package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20120501-17').
